title: 107_hr2252
content: The Act titled "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of conduit contribution ban. The Act titled "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for knowing and willful violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, specifically for violations of section 320. The penalties are not less than 300 percent of the amount involved in the violation and not more than the greater of $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Penalties include fines or imprisonment for knowingly and willfully committing violations involving $1,000 or more in a calendar year. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Violators may face fines or imprisonment for up to 2 years, with fines ranging from 300% to 1000% of the amount involved in the violation. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for these penalties. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for penalties for violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, taking into account variations in the amount involved. Congress must be informed of any guidelines promulgated or amended. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for penalties for violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, considering variations in contribution amounts. The Commission must promulgate the guideline within 90 days of the Act's enactment, following specified procedures. The Reform Act of 1987 makes amendments to the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, including mandatory referral to the Attorney General for violations of section 320 and changes to the statute of limitations. The Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to include a 5-year statute of limitations for violations of section 320. The amendments apply to violations occurring after the enactment of the Act. Extension of ban on foreign contributions to all campaign-related disbursements. The Federal Election Campaign Act is amended to prohibit disbursements by foreign nationals, including those to political committees and for independent expenditures. Effective date of amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section apply to disbursements made on or after the enactment of this Act.
